item.title: Lessig is always right
item.dc:creator: troyh
item.content:encoded: Idiots in Congress (some heavily funded by good 'ol ) "decided" that the US Govt should not fund any software projects that result in GPL code. But Lawrence Lessig correctly explains the absurdity: Giving up proprietary control is the price GPLd code demands, just as all-the-money-in-the-world is the price would demand for similar access to its OS source. Some can pay that price; some cannot.
